BR_text.BRsummary: Documentation for train-split doesn't match with code
BR_text.BRdescription:
In:
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dnouri/skorch/blob/a4eae21d7409c478a05a571ac67e5f18ec996f19/skorch/net.py#L139-L143>https://github.com/dnouri/skorch/blob/a4eae21d7409c478a05a571ac67e5f18ec996f19/skorch/net.py#L139-L143</denchmark-link>
 
 The documentation says that the train-split method should return a (X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val) tuple, however, it appears that it should instead pass a (X_dataset, y_dataset) tuple, as seen in:
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dnouri/skorch/blob/a4eae21d7409c478a05a571ac67e5f18ec996f19/skorch/net.py#L1068-L1069>https://github.com/dnouri/skorch/blob/a4eae21d7409c478a05a571ac67e5f18ec996f19/skorch/net.py#L1068-L1069</denchmark-link>

comments_0.comment_text: Your are right, we forgot to update the docstring when we made a change in CVSplit. Thanks.

comments_1.comment_text: I can create a pull request for this, if needed.  Just let me know.

comments_2.comment_text:
I can create a pull request for this
 
 Yes, that would be great.

comments_3.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/spott>@spott</denchmark-link>
  Are you working on the PR?

 Thanks for the reminder.  I had forgotten about this.
